newsitem.title: USA: NYSE May 5-9 program trade averages 18.7 percent.
newsitem.headline: NYSE May 5-9 program trade averages 18.7 percent.

text.p: The New York Stock Exchange said program trading averaged 18.7 percent of its average daily volume of 531.8 million shares, or 99.5 million shares a day, for the week of May 5-9.
Of the total average daily volume, buy programs accounted for an average 63.5 million shares, while sell programs accounted for an average 36.0 million daily.
In all markets, program trading averaged 99.5 million shares a day during the week of May 5-9.

Of the five member firms reporting the most program activity on the New York Stock Exchange, BNP Securities, Morgan Stanley, Susquehanna Brokerage Services and NatWest conducted most of their program activity for customers. Lehman Brothers executed most of its program activity for its own account.

Program trading executed by firms as agent, for non-member customers, amounted to 61.9 percent during the week, while volume executed as principal, for their own accounts, amounted to 34.1 percent of program volume from May 5-9.
Program trading encompasses trading strategies involving the sale or purchase of a basket of at least 15 stocks with a value of $1 million or more the exchange said.
